name: Clin N Skin
title: Clinical N
notes:
**Note 1:**  Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS, in this field.  Distant nodes are coded in distant metastasis. 

**Note 2:**  Bilateral or contralateral nodes are considered regional nodes  for head, neck, and truncal tumors with bidirectional drainage to primary nodal basins, as shown on lymphoscintigraphy.  Truncal tumors may also drain to both cephalad and caudal primary nodal basins as shown on lymphoscintigraphy.  Clinical assessment of bilateral/contralateral or cephalad/caudal regional nodal involvement is required for tumors where lymphoscintigraphy is not performed.

**Note 3:**  Contiguous or secondary nodal basins are the next nodal drainage basins beyond the primary nodal basins.  Secondary basins are considered regional for TNM.

**Note 4:** Size of lymph nodes must be known to assign N. You may use a physicianâs statement of the N category if this is the only information in the medical record. If the size of the lymph node(s) is not known, assign N1. 

**Note 5:** UICC only defines N2, while AJCC defines N2a, N2b, and N2c. If a record comes in with N2a, N2b, or N2c, reassign it to N2. N2 and the subcategories of N2 all stage the same way.

**Note 6:** For the following descriptions, assign the appropriate N (N1, N2, N3) category based on size of the lymph node metastasis.

    Head and Neck:
    All subsites: Cervical, supraclavicular
    Lip:
        Mandibular, NOS:
        Submandibular (submaxillary)
        Facial, NOS:
            Buccinator (buccal)
            Nasolabial
        Parotid, NOS:
            Infra-auricular
            Preauricular
    External ear/auditory canal:
        Mastoid (post-/retro-auricular) (occipital)
        Preauricular
    Face, Other (cheek, chin, forehead, jaw, nose and temple):
        Facial, NOS:
            Buccinator (buccal)
            Nasolabial
        Mandibular, NOS:
            Submandibular (submaxillary)
        Parotid, NOS:
            Infra-auricular
            Preauricular
    Scalp:
        Mastoid (post-/retro-auricular) (occipital)
        Parotid, NOS:
            Infra-auricular
            Preauricular
        Spinal accessory (posterior cervical)
    Neck:
        Axillary
        Mandibular, NOS
        Mastoid (post-/retro-auricular) (occipital)
        Parotid, NOS:
            Infra-auricular
            Preauricular
        Spinal accessory (posterior cervical)
        Submental
        Supraclavicular (transverse cervical)
    Upper Trunk:
         Axillary
         Cervical
         Internal mammary (parasternal)
         Supraclavicular (transverse cervical)
         Axillary/Femoral (or cephalad/caudal drainage from primary tumor)   

    Lower Trunk:
         Axillary/Femoral (or cephalad/caudal drainage from primary tumor)
         Femoral (superficial inguinal)
         Arm/Shoulder:
         Axillary
         Epitrochlear for hand/forearm
         Spinal accessory for shoulder
         Supraclavicular
    Leg/Hip:
         Femoral (superficial inguinal)
         Iliac
         Popliteal for heel and calf
    All sites: Regional lymph node, NOS
        Regional lymph node(s) in secondary nodal basin, NOS
footnotes: \* For this schema, UICC has only the N2 subcategory. AJCC has subcategories N2a, N2b, or N2c.
rows: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

Clinical evaluation but unknown results or regional lymph node involvement not stated
Clinical evaluation done but results not documented in patient record
Metastasis in a single lymph node, 3 cm or less in greatest dimension

IPSILATERAL positive regional lymph node(s), not stated if single or multiple

Positive lymph nodes,  not stated if ipsilateral, contralateral or bilateral

Regional lymph nodes, NOS
Lymph nodes, NOS

Stated as N1
Metastasis in a single lymph node, more than 3 cm but not more than 6 cm in greatest dimension, or in multiple lymph nodes, none more than 6 cm in greatest dimension*

Multiple ipsilateral lymph nodes, NOS
Bilateral or contralateral lymph nodes, NOS

Stated as N2 (N2a, N2b, N2c, N2 [NOS])
Metastasis in a lymph node, more than 6 cm in great dimension
Clinical N is not defined for the specific site/histology

No clinical evaluation of regional lymph nodes
Cancer first detected on surgical resection
Unknown if any clinical assessment performed
